Package engine.board

Class Board

java.lang.Object
engine.board.Board
public class Board extends Object
Provides infrastructure to manipulate a BoardInfo object. The (make|unmake)Move methods of this class perform automatic move validation. The primary representation of a given chess board is through the BoardInfo class. This class only allows for higher-level management of the informational class. This hierarchy exists to allow for the BoardInfo object to be easily transported, serialized, and deserialized without having to carry around the extra methods provided by the Board class.

  • Method Details

    • getInfo

      public BoardInfo getInfo()
      Returns this object's BoardInfo object. The object returned is a deep-copy of the actual informational object stored in this class. No reference of the returned object is kept by this class, allowing for safe end-user manipulation of the returned object.
      Returns:
      this object's BoardInfo object.

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Move move)
      Updates the BoardInfo object managed by this class with a given Move. The argument move is validated under some basic conditions before any operation is completed, but the legality of the move (e.g. whether it is part of MoveGenerator.generateLegalMoves) is NOT validated. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure the move is legal. An unspecified behavior will occur if an illegal, but valid, move is passed. This method will throw exceptions upon failure to perform the move.

      A "valid" move is defined as follows:

      • move != null
      • endTile.isValidTile() == true. NOTE that the validity of the start tile is not validated. This allows this method to conform to the customizable focus of this chess engine; that is, it can be safely assumed all end tiles must always be valid, but start tiles may not always be used (e.g. -1, -1 as a non-null placeholder).
      • The piece on startTile is non-null
      • A "valid" move is NOT necessarily a legal move (where legal means generated by MoveGenerator.generateLegalMoves)
      Parameters:
      move - the move to make.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if move == null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the end tile is not valid or the piece on the start tile is null.
      See Also:
      • Move

    • unmakeMove

      public void unmakeMove()
      Undoes the next available move in the boardHistory stack.
